text:
Vijayadharani meets CM

At the end of the Assembly session, Congress MLA Vijayadharani, who was removed from her post as Tamil Nadu Mahila Congress chief, was in the queue of MLAs waiting to meet Chief Minister Jayalalithaa.

After waiting patiently for five minutes, Ms. Vijayadharani gave a file to the Chief Minister. Later, she told reporters that the file was about the delay in the work related to the Oceanarium, the pet project of the Chief Minister.

Formal joining

Rebel DMDK MLAs also had a brief interaction with the Chief Minister at the end of the Assembly session. While everyone praised her for the excellent speech, one of the MLAs asked when they could formally join the AIADMK. “There is still the budget session,” Ms. Jayalalithaa said.

No word on Chembarambakkam

Detailing the flood relief efforts taken by her government, the Chief Minister did not talk about the Chembarambakkam water release issue at all.

As the Finance and PWD Minister had replied to the issue only the day before, Ms. Jayalalithaa said allegations were levelled against her government in the House and outside.

“Even if proper explanations are given, they continue to repeat their lies thinking that people would believe them. Tamils are rational and know how to differentiate between truth and lie,” she said.
title: Assembly snippets
